Posts.Content: Wondermommy3 wrote: I had my excisional biopsy today at 12 I was under general anesthesia so Ofcourse I don't remember anything. The doctor said it went very well and we will know results in 3-5 days, I am very sore and have a huge bandage covering my entire breast but my hubby is wonderful and taking care of all 3 of our children (5 and under) and making supper and spoiling me :) praying for b9 results! Posts.Title: At home resting after surgery Wondermommy3 heather37

Posts.Content: Wondermommy3 wrote: well tomorrow is the big day.. I've done so good the past two weeks not worrying too much and keeping busy but today it hit me like freight train and my nerves are shot! Has anyone else has the overwhelming desire to call and cancel their procedure?? Ofcourse I'm NOT going to but oh how I would love to just be able to pretend like it isn't there and maybe just maybe it will disappear ... Just day dreaming.. I know I can't be the only one to feel that way. Anyway please say a prayer for me tomorrow at 10:30am! I will let y'all know how it goes! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy day tomorrow Wondermommy3 Lynette73

Posts.Content: Wondermommy3 wrote: have any of you ladies ever been diagnosed with microglandular adenosis? And if so what was your course of treatment or monitoring after diagnosis? Waiting to hear from Duke for my second opinion appointment but I have never heard of someone being diagnosed in their 20s, I'm 25 as it is a rare condition. Just wondering if any other ladies on here have been through this before :) Log in to post a reply
